title: Can Edge of Night and Banshee's Veil have the same unique passive name?
body:
Both are annoying, but when you stack them is when it gets excessive. Like how Maw and Sterak's have the same unique passive name, but different functionalities, these two items should have the same kind of set-up. For example, take Rengar with {{item:3102}} {{item:3814}} {{item:3139}} and {{item:3156}} is 4.5 ability defenses (2 full blocks, 1 shield, 2 hard cc removals) which all more or less need to be burned to actually start to kill him with AP based abilities. Add a {{item:3222}} on an ally and he now has 2 of every anti-ability/hard CC function.

But back to my point. these two items should have the same unique passive name since they do almost the exact same thing, but currently can be stacked.

I actually think that EoN and QSS/Merc should share a passive name. That combo of items is just far too good, it makes it impossible to even touch an ADC as a CC based tank or support.

Edge is a spellshield.
QSS/Merc is a non-summoner spell cleanse.
You can't use edge after being stunned, and you can't use QSS/Merc as a spellshield to prevent CC in the first place.

They are completely different things.
I don't disagree that having both makes people really hard to CC, but it also means they are sacrificing potential damage output.
